metadata.title: The SALMON Project's GLOBEC Mesoscale Survey
metadata.description:
Comprehensive surveys of the Alaskan waters to map physical and biological oceanographic characteristics associated with the Alaska Coastal Current using the SeaSoar, an open ocean undulating data acquisition vehicle.  The survey occurred in May and July - August, 2003 with a coverage area from the western end of Prince William Sound to Kodiak Island.  Salinity, temperature, nitrate, and chlorophyll data were collected.

  A Sea-Air-Land Modeling and Observing Network (SALMON) Project, in conjunction with the Northeast Pacific GLOBEC program.
metadata.notes:
